results.description: England's Tyrrell Hatton is back and that is great news for British and European golf, writes Iain Carter.
results.title: 'Tyrrell Hatton's Turkish Open win great for British golf'

results.description: Scottish pair Calum Hill and Connor Syme have earned places on the European Tour after finishing in the top 15 of the final Challenge Tour rankings.
results.shortTitle: Hill and Syme secure European Tour rights
results.title: Calum Hill and Connor Syme secure playing rights on European Tour for 2020

results.description: Northern Ireland's Cormac Sharvin earns a full European Tour card for next season despite a poor finish in the Challenge Tour Grand Final.
results.title: Cormac Sharvin: NI golfer secures European Tour card for next season

results.description: Ryder Cup player Tyrrell Hatton wins the Turkish Open in dramatic fashion at the fourth extra hole following a six-man play-off.
results.shortTitle: Hatton wins six-man play-off in Turkey
results.title: Turkish Open: Tyrrell Hatton wins six-man play-off

results.description: England's Eddie Pepperell is disqualified from the Turkish Open after running out of balls on the 13th hole of his third round.
results.shortTitle: Pepperell disqualified after running out of balls
results.title: Turkish Open: Eddie Pepperell disqualified after running out of balls

results.description: Cavan golfer Lisa Maguire announces her retirement from the professional ranks to focus on growing the women's game in Ireland.
results.shortTitle: Maguire calls time on career at 24
results.title: Lisa Maguire retires from golf to focus on growing women's game in Ireland

results.description: Justin Rose remains two off the lead at the halfway stage of the Turkish Open, as he goes for a third straight win.
results.shortTitle: Rose two off Turkish Open lead at halfway
results.title: Turkish Open: Justin Rose two off lead as he goes for hat-trick of wins

results.description: Captain Tiger Woods names himself as one of four wildcard selections for the US team at the Presidents Cup.
results.shortTitle: Woods picks himself for Presidents Cup
results.title: Tiger Woods picks himself for Presidents Cup as one of four wildcards

results.description: Former world top-20 golfer Chris Kirk will make his return to the PGA Tour after addressing his struggles with alcohol and anxiety.
results.shortTitle: Kirk to return after alcohol struggle
results.title: Chris Kirk to make return to PGA Tour after dealing with alcohol and anxiety

results.description: Tom Lewis holds a share of the lead at the Turkish Open, with defending champion Justin Rose two shots back.
results.shortTitle: Lewis leads as Rose goes for hat-trick
results.title: Turkish Open: England's Tom Lewis leads as Justin Rose goes for hat-trick of wins

results.description: International team captain Ernie Els names Australian Jason Day as one of his four wildcard picks for next month's Presidents Cup in Melbourne.
results.shortTitle: Day picked as Presidents Cup wildcard
results.title: Presidents Cup: Jason Day picked as wildcard by captain Ernie Els

results.description: A chance encounter in the US led Donaghadee Golf Club's Trevor Hillen to come up with the idea of setting up Ireland's first disabled friendly golf hub.
results.title: Donaghadee sets up Ireland's first disabled friendly golf hub

thumbnail.altText: Donaghadee man Gareth McNeely at the launch of his club's Inclusive Golf Hub
Donaghadee man Gareth McNeely at the launch of his club's Inclusive Golf Hub
Donaghadee man Gareth McNeely at the launch of his club's Inclusive Golf Hub
Donaghadee man Gareth McNeely at the launch of his club's Inclusive Golf Hub

results.description: Donaghadee Golf Club recently launched a trial Disabled Golf Hub with the aim of getting more people involved with the sport.
results.shortTitle: Donaghadee first facility of its kind in Ireland for disabled golfers
results.title: Donaghadee launches first Disability Golf Hub in bid to "get more people involved"

results.description: Simthandile Tshabalala, aged seven, has been nicknamed “SimTiger” and marked out as a future star.
results.shortTitle: SA golf prodigy wants to be 'best in the world'
results.title: South African golfer SimTiger aims for world championship

results.description: For the first time since John Major was prime minister and Meat Loaf was number one, Phil Mickelson has dropped out of the world top 50.
results.shortTitle: Mickelson drops out of world top 50
results.title: Phil Mickelson drops out of world top 50 for first time in 26 years

results.description: There are plenty of big-money opportunities in the closing weeks of the European Tour season, writes golf correspondent Iain Carter.
results.shortTitle: 'European Tour takes limelight and set for fascinating conclusion'
results.title: Bernd Wiesberger & Jon Rahm among players chasing Race to Dubai title

thumbnail.altText: Bernd Wiesberger with the Italian Open trophy

results.description: American Brendon Todd wins his second PGA Tour title with a four-shot win at the Bermuda Championship.
results.shortTitle: World number 525 Todd seals Bermuda win
results.title: Bermuda Championship: World number 525 Brendon Todd seals four-shot win

thumbnail.altText: Brendon Todd at the Bermuda Championship

results.description: Northern Ireland's Rory McIlroy wins the WGC-HSBC Champions in Shanghai after beating defending champion Xander Schauffele a play-off.
results.shortTitle: McIlroy wins in China after play-off
results.title: WGC-HSBC Champions: Rory McIlroy beats Xander Schauffele in play-off to win in China

results.description: American Nelly Korda defends the Taiwan Swinging Skirts LPGA after a three-way play-off.
results.title: Taiwan Swinging Skirts LPGA: American Nelly Korda retains title after three-way play-off

results.description: Northern Ireland's Rory McIlroy takes a one-shot lead going into the final round of the WGC-HSBC Champions in Shanghai.
results.title: WGC-HSBC Champions: Rory McIlroy leads Louis Oosthuizen by one shot in China
